newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria offers 3-yr coupon T-notes Friday.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria offers 3-yr coupon T-notes Friday.

text.p: Bulgaria's Finance Ministry will offer on Friday an issue of 3-year, floated coupon T-notes with a par value of 35 billion levs, the central bank said.
The issue is offered with no minimum acceptable price set in advance.
The coupon of the issue equals the central bank's main interest rate for the period to maturity and changes every time the rate is changed.
The main interest rate is now set at 9.76 percent annually.
The central bank also said the finance ministry had cut the share of non-competitive bids to five percent of the total par value from 30 percent previously.

A Finance Ministry official said this would allow banks to place more funds through competitive orders, which are approved on the basis of the prices offered, unlike non-competitive bids approved according to the time they were placed.
The price of non-competitive bids is equal to the average price of the competitive bids approved.
